metadata.case_name: Assessee Company v. State of Bihar

facts.text: The appellant is a private limited company and producer of sugar cane.
Sales tax assessments for years 1950-51 (Rs. 28,866), 1951-52 (Rs. 23,383), and 1952-53 (Rs. 23,298) levied on sale of sugar cane.
Appellant objected to assessments and filed appeals to Deputy Commissioner of Commercial Taxes.
Appellant filed revision to Board of Revenue.

Board of Revenue referred question to Patna High Court: 'Whether sugar cane is a green vegetable within the meaning of item 6 of notification No. 9884-FT dated 28-8-47 and as such exempt from taxation.'
Patna High Court on May 13, 1959, held sugar cane not included in 'green vegetables' in Misc. Judicial Case No. 352 of 1957.
Appellant filed three appeals by special leave to Supreme Court.
Appellant filed three petitions under Art. 32 challenging constitutionality of assessments.
Notification No. 9884-FT dated August 28, 1947, issued under s.6 Bihar Sales Tax Act, 1947, exempts 'Green vegetables other than potatoes' except when sold in sealed containers.

legal_issues.text: Whether sugar cane falls within the term 'green vegetables' and is therefore exempt from sales tax under notification dated August 28, 1947, issued under s.6 of Bihar Sales Tax Act, 1947.
Whether the appellant, being a producer of sugar cane, is a 'dealer' within the meaning of s.2(c) of the Bihar Sales Tax Act, 1947.
Whether the amendment to the definition of 'dealer' by Bihar Annual Finance Act, 1950, applies only to the financial year beginning April 1, 1950.
Whether assent of the President was required for Bihar Annual Finance Act, 1950.

petitioner_arguments.text: Sugar cane falls within 'green vegetables' in entry 6 of the Schedule to notification No. 9884-FT dated 28-8-47 and is exempt from sales tax.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Notification No. 9884-FT dated 28-8-47 under s.6 Bihar Sales Tax Act; State of Bombay v. R. S. Phadtara (Bombay High Court)

petitioner_arguments.text: Appellant, as producer of sugar cane, is not a 'dealer' within s.2(c) of the Act.
Definition of 'dealer' amended by Bihar Annual Finance Act 1950 applies only for financial year beginning April 1, 1950, per preamble.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Preamble to Bihar Annual Finance Act 1950; s.2(c) Bihar Sales Tax Act

petitioner_arguments.text: Bihar Annual Finance Act 1950 required assent of President.

respondent_arguments.text: Sugar cane is not a green vegetable within the exemption.

court_reasoning.text: Word 'vegetable' in taxing statutes to be understood in common parlance as denoting class of vegetables grown in kitchen garden or farm and used for the table; sugar cane does not fall within this.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Sugar cane defined in dictionaries as grass grown for sugar, not vegetable.

court_reasoning.text: S.2(c) definition of 'dealer' is wide and covers appellant as person who sells goods.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Includes any person who sells or supplies goods whether for commission, remuneration or otherwise.

court_reasoning.text: Preamble to Bihar Annual Finance Act 1950 does not limit amended s.2(c) to one year; plain words apply.
Tax on sale of goods is under Entry 54 State List; no President's assent required for amendment.

holdings.text: Sugar cane is not a 'green vegetable' within entry 6 of notification dated 28-8-47.
Appellant company is a 'dealer' under s.2(c) Bihar Sales Tax Act.
Amended definition of 'dealer' in Bihar Annual Finance Act 1950 applies beyond one year.
No assent of President required for Bihar Annual Finance Act 1950.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of Bombay v. R. S. Phadtara
precedents_cited.relevance: Appellant relied on Bombay HC holding sugar cane as fresh vegetable exempt; court disagreed preferring common parlance.

precedents_cited.case_name: Ramavtar Badriprasad v. Assistant Sales Tax Officer, Akola
precedents_cited.relevance: Held betel leaves not 'vegetables' in taxing statute; word to be understood in common parlance.

precedents_cited.case_name: Madhya Pradesh Pan Merchants Association v. State of Madhya Pradesh
precedents_cited.relevance: Quoted with approval: vegetables mean those grown in kitchen garden or farm for table.

statutes_cited.name: Bihar Sales Tax Act, 1947 (Bihar Act XIX of 1947)
statutes_cited.relevance: Provides exemption by notification; defines 'dealer' widely to include sellers of goods.

statutes_cited.name: Bihar Annual Finance Act, 1950
statutes_cited.relevance: Amended definition of 'dealer'; applies generally, not temporarily.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed the three appeals by special leave and three petitions under Art. 32, holding sugar cane not exempt as 'green vegetables', appellant is a 'dealer', amendment applies, and no President's assent needed.

key_quotes.text: 'the word vegetable in taxing statutes is to be understood as in common parlance i.e. denoting class of vegetables which are grown in a kitchen garden or in a farm and are used for the table.'
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Defines scope of 'vegetables' excluding sugar cane.

key_quotes.text: 'dealer means any person who sells or supplies any goods... whether for commission, remuneration or otherwise'
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: 'In its plain and natural meaning a vegetable clearly is wide enough to cover sugar cane'
key_quotes.speaker: petitioner_counsel
key_quotes.significance: Petitioner's reliance on Bombay HC, rejected by court.
